body:
### Problem

Same as https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter/issues/5643

When I try to fold I get

> E490: No fold found

And when I run

```vim
echo v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()
```

it prints `0`, no matter my cursor position. I tried reloading the file with `:e` and also recompute folds with `zx`, but with no effect.

### Steps to reproduce

1. `nvim -u nvim_test_config.vim /some/cpp/file.cpp`
2. move cursor into a function scope, such as int main()
3. `za`, or `zM`
4. Get "E490: No folds found"


### Expected behavior

Folds should exist and close

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-e59cf3b3a

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no, this is a nvim only feature

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu Mate 22.04

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.30.1

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

built from repo

comment_data.body: Please share your exact test config and cpp file.

You mean did if I ran `TSInstall cpp`? yes.

TSModuleInfo:

```text

>> default          autotag  highlight  incremental_selection  indent  matchup  
[...]
cpp                 ✗        ✓          ✓                      ✗       ✓        
```

I'm not sure what indent actually does. The documentation says only

> Indentation based on treesitter for the |=| operator.

So I assume it is some kind of auto indentation feature, which I don't want since I use clang-format with coc. Regardless, it doesn't change the outcome whether I turn it on or off.

> Do you have `foldmethod=expr` set

Yes. Check the example config.
@FalcoGer the configuration you provided doesn't list which parsers you have installed. Do you have both the `c` and `cpp` Treesitter parsers?

Yes.

I have these treesitter parsers installed.

```text
c cpp bash c_sharp cmake css diff dockerfile git_config git_rebase gitattributes gitcommit gitignore go html http ini java javascript json json5 latex lua make markdown markdown_inline meson ninja objc passwd pem perl php phpdoc python regex ruby rust sql typescript vim vimdoc yaml
```

`:TSModuleInfo`

I have the same question with the latest neovim version (NVIM v0.10.0-dev-64c2c7c).
Did you check the foldmethod while entering nvim?

I set `vim.o.foldmethod="expr"`. But when I open one file, the `foldmethod` always becomes `manual`. 
And after I execute `set foldmethod=expr`, all things work fine.
That just means some plugins of yours or some ftplugin files are overriding foldexpr.

> That just means some plugins of yours or some ftplugin files are overriding foldexpr. I think so. But I put `vim.o.foldmethod="expr"` the last line in `init.lua`. I have no idea if any plugins will overriding `foldmthod`. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/39361033/e1bf6261-51fe-452d-9e69-d1910dfaa30b

> I have the same question with the latest neovim version (NVIM v0.10.0-dev-64c2c7c). Did you check the foldmethod while entering nvim?
> 
> I set `vim.o.foldmethod="expr"`. But when I open one file, the `foldmethod` always becomes `manual`. And after I execute `set foldmethod=expr`, all things work fine.

That is not the problem I'm having. My `foldmethod` is `expr`. I know that coc's fold creates manual folds, but I'm not doing that.

[![asciicast](https://asciinema.org/a/8Iq9mxJ4yN0rkZayHmJyVdxo1.svg)](https://asciinema.org/a/8Iq9mxJ4yN0rkZayHmJyVdxo1)

I recompiled the latest neovim nightly and now it works.
Just `set foldtext=v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldtext()` gives me nothing. But I can live with that and roll my own function.

title: foldexpr=v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr() doesn't fold
